intro: Saccocalyx halicacabus, commonly known as the desert sow-thistle, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa, Asia, and Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and basal rosettes of spoon-shaped leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in composite heads, typical of the daisy family. It is adapted to survive in harsh environments through its succulent leaves and deep root system. Saccocalyx halicacabus is often considered a weed but has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
